dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Brief
dataObjects.description: "Red List Category & Criteria: Least Concern ver 3.1  Year Assessed: 2010 Assessor/s: Gupta, A.K. Reviewer/s: Ravikumar, K., Narasimhan, D., Rao, M.L.V., Gunaga, S. & Juffe Bignoli, D. Contributors: Drius, M. & Smith, K. Justification: This species is native to India, Indochina and Malaysia. It is a common aquatic plant that faces no major threats and covers a wide geographic range. It is therefore listed as Least Concern. Conservation Actions: No information."

agents.full_name: "G. Renu, Sanjana Julias Thilakar, D. Narasimhan, Centre for Floristic Research, Department of Botany, Madras Christian College, Tambaram"

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.title: Distribution
dataObjects.description: "Maharashtra: Kolhapur, Raigad, Ratnagiri, Sindhudurg Karnataka: N. Kanara, Shimoga, S. Kanara"

agents.full_name: "G. Renu, Sanjana Julias Thilakar, D. Narasimhan, Centre for Floristic Research, Department of Botany, Madras Christian College, Tambaram"

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.title: Distribution
dataObjects.description: "Range Description: Hygrophila pinnatifida is native to the Indian subcontinent, Indochina and Malaysia. It is introduced to the United States. Countries -  Native: Cambodia; India; Lao People's Democratic Republic; Malaysia; Viet Nam. Introduced: United States"

agents.full_name: "G. Renu, Sanjana Julias Thilakar, D. Narasimhan, Centre for Floristic Research, Department of Botany, Madras Christian College, Tambaram"

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Habitat
dataObjects.title: General Habitat
dataObjects.description: "Habitat and Ecology: It grows in running water, rocky and gravelly streams. In vegetative stage it is totally submerged in water. Commonly found growing in large or small water bodies either floating or submerged.  Systems: Freshwater List of Habitats: 5, 5.1, 5.5"

Justification
This species is native to India, Indochina and Malaysia. It is a common aquatic plant that faces no major threats and covers a wide geographic range. It is therefore listed as Least Concern.
